page.title: 11 Coronation Hall S.Clifton.
page.content: The Coronation Hall was built in 1937 at the time of the Coronation of King George VI and financed by local funds. It was constructed from timber and was a long,narrow building with a stage at one end.It was used for dances,drama productions and local clubs.It was found to be a little restricted in its use so it was decided to refurbish it. In 1981 the walls were move outwards and constructed of brick.New toilets were built alongside an entrance hall,a kitchen was added and also a committee room with a storeroom at the back.A new heating system was put in. The Women's Institute Concert Party raised money to provide curtains and stage curtains.A Committe is in charge of the running of the hall and has a caretaker rota system.it is used for many functions such as shows parties,dances and private parties..
